problem.p: If the height of a truss increases, what happens to the magnitude of the forces in the diagonal members of the truss shown below in green?

choicegroup.label: If the height of a truss increases, what happens to the magnitude of the forces in the diagonal members of the truss shown below in green?
choicegroup.choice: The force in these diagonal members will increase
The force in these diagonal members will decrease
The force in these diagonal members will remain the same

div.p: As the height increases the force in these diagonal members will decrease. Similarly to funicular forms, as the height increases, more of the force in the bar or truss member will resist the applied vertical loads.
